intro: Antidesma novoguineense, commonly known as the Guinean antidesma, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to the rainforests of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Antidesma novoguineense is often found in shaded, humid environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
